oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Twenty-seventh Avenue Church of Christ, 2001 November 17
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the former Twenty-seventh Avenue Church of Christ located at 526 Twenty-seventh Avenue North, in Nashville, Tennessee. The foundation is a concrete block. The exterior walls are made of red brick. The roof is made of asphalt shingles, and the window panes are plastic. Concrete steps lead up to a set of wooden doors. In 1964, the building became the church for the Hosea Temple Cumberland Presbyterian Church. Since then, the church's congregation has held various versions of the Hosea name, including Hosea Community Church. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Twenty-seventh Avenue Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.); Hosea Temple Cumberland Presbyterian Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Hosea Community Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
